idan72,

There is no easy way with JUnit 4.5, but it's functionality we're
going to need in .6 or .7.  Can you make sure there's a feature
request for it?

If you need to brainstorm about hard ways to do it, let me know.

   David Saff

On Sun, Oct 5, 2008 at 4:33 PM, idan72 <ishai@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> How can I know when a beforeclass is starting?
>
> Today with the listener I can know when test start but I need to also know
> when @BeforeClass method and @AfterClass method starts.
>
> It is very important to our project.
>
> Thanks
